free_txt: Request for the newer data was sent to A.Plompen.

bib_record.title: New cross section measurements for neutron-induced  reactions on Cr, Ni, Cu, Ta and W isotopes obtained  with the activation technique

free_txt: - neutron flux and energy distribution inside the
stack of sample and monitor foils
Coaxial HPGe detector. Calibration was done
with standard point sources and also by MCNP5.
No information on sources of uncertainties
Ti/T target (2 mg/cm2 thick) on Ag backing (0.4 mm
Distance between the sample stack and the center of
target varied from 3 cm (for 10 mm diam. samples) to
Neutron energy and yield distribution were determined
by EnergySet code based on DROSG-2000 and Ziegler's
Neutron flux density distributions were determined by
the spectral index method by using the following
Natural Cr (30 mm diam.x5 mm), nominal weight 25500 mg.
Contribution of 55Mn(n,2n)54Mn is less than 1% if the
cross section is 800 mb and Mn impurity is 100 ppm;
Contribution of 54Fe(n,p)54Mn is less than 0.1% if the
cross section is 200 mb and Fe impurity is 40 ppm.
Natural Ni (14 mm diam.x5 mm), nominal weight 5000 mg.
Natural Ni (14 mm diam.x5 mm), nominal weight 5000 mg.
Impurities of Fe, Co and Ni can contribute to 59Fe
traces produced by other high cross section
reactions on the above mentioned elements in the
